name: lbann

conflicts.name: +cuda
conflicts.description: lbann: CUDA and ROCm support are mutually exclusive

conflicts.name: +gold
conflicts.description: lbann: gold does not work on Darwin

conflicts.name: +lld
conflicts.description: lbann: lld does not work on Darwin

variants.name: rocm
variants.description: Enable ROCm support

variants.name: amdgpu_target
variants.description: AMD GPU architecture

variants.name: cuda
variants.description: Build with CUDA

variants.name: cuda_arch
variants.description: CUDA architecture

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: build_type
variants.description: The build type to build

variants.name: ipo
variants.description: CMake interprocedural optimization

variants.name: generator
variants.description: the build system generator to use

variants.name: deterministic
variants.description: Builds with support for deterministic execution

variants.name: distconv
variants.description: Builds with support for spatial, filter, or channel distributed convolutions

variants.name: dtype
variants.description: Type for floating point representation of weights

variants.name: fft
variants.description: Support for FFT operations

variants.name: half
variants.description: Builds with support for FP16 precision data types

variants.name: nvprof
variants.description: Build with region annotations for NVPROF

variants.name: numpy
variants.description: Builds with support for processing NumPy data files

variants.name: vision
variants.description: Builds with support for image processing data with OpenCV

variants.name: vtune
variants.description: Builds with support for Intel VTune

variants.name: onednn
variants.description: Support for OneDNN

variants.name: onnx
variants.description: Support for exporting models into ONNX format

variants.name: nvshmem
variants.description: Support for NVSHMEM

variants.name: python
variants.description: Support for Python extensions (e.g. Data Reader)

variants.name: pfe
variants.description: Python Frontend for generating and launching models

variants.name: boost
variants.description: Enable callbacks that use Boost libraries

variants.name: asan
variants.description: Build with support for address-sanitizer

variants.name: unit_tests
variants.description: Support for unit testing

variants.name: caliper
variants.description: Support for instrumentation with caliper

variants.name: shared
variants.description: Enables the build of shared libraries

variants.name: gold
variants.description: Use gold high performance linker

variants.name: lld
variants.description: Use lld high performance linker

description:
LBANN: Livermore Big Artificial Neural Network Toolkit. A distributed
memory, HPC-optimized, model and data parallel training toolkit for deep
neural networks.

dependencies.name: aluminum
dependencies.description:
Aluminum provides a generic interface to high-performance communication
libraries, with a focus on allreduce algorithms. Blocking and non-
blocking algorithms and GPU-aware algorithms are supported. Aluminum
also contains custom implementations of select algorithms to optimize
for certain situations.

dependencies.name: caliper
dependencies.description:
Caliper is a program instrumentation and performance measurement
framework. It is designed as a performance analysis toolbox in a
library, allowing one to bake performance analysis capabilities directly
into applications and activate them at runtime.

dependencies.name: catch2
dependencies.description:
Catch2 is a multi-paradigm test framework for C++, which also supports
Objective-C (and maybe C).

dependencies.name: cereal
dependencies.description:
cereal is a header-only C++11 serialization library. cereal takes
arbitrary data types and reversibly turns them into different
representations, such as compact binary encodings, XML, or JSON. cereal
was designed to be fast, light-weight, and easy to extend - it has no
external dependencies and can be easily bundled with other code or used
standalone.

dependencies.name: clara
dependencies.description: A simple to use, composable, command line parser for C++ 11 and beyond.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: cnpy
dependencies.description: cnpy: library to read/write .npy and .npz files in C/C++.

dependencies.name: conduit
dependencies.description:
Conduit is an open source project from Lawrence Livermore National
Laboratory that provides an intuitive model for describing hierarchical
scientific data in C++, C, Fortran, and Python. It is used for data
coupling between packages in-core, serialization, and I/O tasks.

dependencies.name: cuda
dependencies.description:
CUDA is a parallel computing platform and programming model invented by
NVIDIA. It enables dramatic increases in computing performance by
harnessing the power of the graphics processing unit (GPU). Note: This
package does not currently install the drivers necessary to run CUDA.
These will need to be installed manually. See:
https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/ for details.

dependencies.name: cudnn
dependencies.description:
NVIDIA cuDNN is a GPU-accelerated library of primitives for deep neural
networks

dependencies.name: cutensor
dependencies.description:
NVIDIA cuTENSOR Library is a GPU-accelerated tensor linear algebra
library providing tensor contraction, reduction and elementwise
operations.

dependencies.name: dihydrogen
dependencies.description:
DiHydrogen is the second version of the Hydrogen fork of the well-known
distributed linear algebra library, Elemental. DiHydrogen aims to be a
basic distributed multilinear algebra interface with a particular
emphasis on the needs of the distributed machine learning effort, LBANN.

dependencies.name: fftw
dependencies.description:
FFTW is a C subroutine library for computing the discrete Fourier
transform (DFT) in one or more dimensions, of arbitrary input size, and
of both real and complex data (as well as of even/odd data, i.e. the
discrete cosine/sine transforms or DCT/DST). We believe that FFTW, which
is free software, should become the FFT library of choice for most
applications.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: half
dependencies.description:
This is a C++ header-only library to provide an IEEE-754 conformant
half-precision floating point type along with corresponding arithmetic
operators, type conversions and common mathematical functions. It aims
for both efficiency and ease of use, trying to accurately mimic the
behaviour of the builtin floating point types at the best performance
possible. It automatically uses and provides C++11 features when
possible, but stays completely C++98-compatible when neccessary.

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: hip
dependencies.description:
HIP is a C++ Runtime API and Kernel Language that allows developers to
create portable applications for AMD and NVIDIA GPUs from single source
code.

dependencies.name: hipcub
dependencies.description: Radeon Open Compute Parallel Primitives Library

dependencies.name: hiptt
dependencies.description: hipTT - Fast GPU Tensor Transpose for NVIDIA and AMD GPU.

dependencies.name: hsa-rocr-dev
dependencies.description:
This repository includes the user mode API nterfaces and libraries
necessary for host applications to launch computer kernels to available
HSA ROCm kernel agents.AMD Heterogeneous System Architecture HSA - Linux
HSA Runtime for Boltzmann (ROCm) platforms.

dependencies.name: hwloc
dependencies.description:
The Hardware Locality (hwloc) software project. The Portable Hardware
Locality (hwloc) software package provides a portable abstraction
(across OS, versions, architectures, ...) of the hierarchical topology
of modern architectures, including NUMA memory nodes, sockets, shared
caches, cores and simultaneous multithreading. It also gathers various
system attributes such as cache and memory information as well as the
locality of I/O devices such as network interfaces, InfiniBand HCAs or
GPUs. It primarily aims at helping applications with gathering
information about modern computing hardware so as to exploit it
accordingly and efficiently.

dependencies.name: hydrogen
dependencies.description:
Hydrogen: Distributed-memory dense and sparse-direct linear algebra and
optimization library. Based on the Elemental library.

dependencies.name: llvm-amdgpu
dependencies.description:
Toolkit for the construction of highly optimized compilers, optimizers,
and run-time environments.

dependencies.name: llvm-openmp
dependencies.description:
The OpenMP subproject of LLVM contains the components required to build
an executable OpenMP program that are outside the compiler itself.

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description:
Mvapich2 is a High-Performance MPI Library for clusters with diverse
networks (InfiniBand, Omni-Path, Ethernet/iWARP, and RoCE) and computing
platforms (x86 (Intel and AMD), ARM and OpenPOWER)

dependencies.name: nccl
dependencies.description: Optimized primitives for collective multi-GPU communication.

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependencies.name: nvshmem
dependencies.description:
NVSHMEM is a parallel programming interface based on OpenSHMEM that
provides efficient and scalable communication for NVIDIA GPU clusters.
NVSHMEM creates a global address space for data that spans the memory of
multiple GPUs and can be accessed with fine-grained GPU-initiated
operations, CPU-initiated operations, and operations on CUDA streams.

dependencies.name: onednn
dependencies.description:
oneAPI Deep Neural Network Library (oneDNN). Formerly known as Intel
MKL-DNN and DNNL.

dependencies.name: onnx
dependencies.description:
Open Neural Network Exchange (ONNX). ONNX provides an open source format
for AI models, both deep learning and traditional ML. It defines an
extensible computation graph model, as well as definitions of built-in
operators and standard data types.

dependencies.name: opencv
dependencies.description:
OpenCV (Open Source Computer Vision Library) is an open source computer
vision and machine learning software library.

dependencies.name: protobuf
dependencies.description: Google's data interchange format.

dependencies.name: py-protobuf
dependencies.description:
Protocol buffers are Google's language-neutral, platform-neutral,
extensible mechanism for serializing structured data - think XML, but
smaller, faster, and simpler. You define how you want your data to be
structured once, then you can use special generated source code to
easily write and read your structured data to and from a variety of data
streams and using a variety of languages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: python
dependencies.description: The Python programming language.

dependencies.name: python-venv
dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment

dependencies.name: roctracer-dev
dependencies.description:
ROC-tracer library: Runtimes Generic Callback/Activity APIs. The goal of
the implementation is to provide a generic independent from specific
runtime profiler to trace API and asyncronous activity.

dependencies.name: spdlog
dependencies.description: Very fast, header only, C++ logging library

dependencies.name: zlib-api
dependencies.description: zlib replacement with optimizations for next generation systems.

dependencies.name: zstr
dependencies.description:
This C++ header-only library enables the use of C++ standard iostreams
to access ZLib-compressed streams.
